actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1039.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure failed of passage in House under Suspension of rules, roll call #318 (218-145).
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #626 (317-86).
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase the amount of the stock which certain private foundations may hold in certain public utilities without being subject to the excise tax on excess business holdings.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #626 (317-86)) Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend to 20 years the time period during which a private foundation may hold voting stock in certain public utilities without being subject to the excise tax on excess business holdings. Stipulates that such stock must have been held on May 26, 1969, and have been acquired by gift, devise, or bequest from an individual who is not an officer of the foundation nor has any family members who are officers.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase the amount of the stock which certain private foundations may hold in certain public utilities without being subject to the excise tax on excess business holdings.
